summary:
The Secretary-General is requested to report on progress on human rights, international humanitarian law, and rule of law, and to ensure compliance with the UN's zero-tolerance policy on sexual exploitation and abuse.

The authorization for French forces to support UNOCI is extended until 31 December 2010. The Council underscores the importance of Ivorian security forces using proportionate force and being equipped with appropriate crowd control equipment.
The Security Council:

Requests the Secretary-General to inform it of the publication of the final voters list and provide reports on the situation on the ground, implementation of this resolution, and revised benchmarks by 22 October 2010 and 30 November 2010.

Intends to review UNOCI's mandate, structure, and strength, as well as the authorization for French forces and benchmarks, by 31 December 2010, considering all options, including those listed in the Secretary-General's report of 20 May 2010.

Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
